title: Love Island's Anna Vakili disgusted by vile racist trolls
text:
Peas in a pod (Picture: Anna Vakili/Instagram)

Love Island’s Anna Vakili has revealed wouldn’t have been able to handle racist trolls without the support of her sister.

The 29-year-old and her sister suffered from online attacks when bullies branded them ‘terrorists’ or used ‘Arab’ as a racial slur and at times found it hard to handle.

Speaking exclusively to Metro.co.uk, Anna said: ‘It has affected me. [My sister Mandi] will be there to pick me up and tell me to ignore it.

‘I’ll be in bed really upset and she’ll sit on my bed with me and talk to me about it. No normal person does that, sits and insults someone like that.’

The former pharmacist – who has no intention of returning to her former career – previously said she felt like she got targeted more than the other Islanders.

‘The thing I love about black communities is that they stick together, but Middle Easterns … they don’t have that support,’ she claimed.

‘When I’m getting DMs like “you Arab ****”, “you terrorist”, stuff like that is a sensitive topic and people were getting at me about that.’

Anna was targeted more than the other Islanders while on the show (Picture: ITV)

The sisters are very close (Picture: Simmi London)

We all recently found out that the Love Island group chat is ‘dead’ and got collectively upset about it.

But then, Curtis chimed in to say the group chat apparently wasn’t dead, people were just ‘busy’.

‘I didn’t say everyone hates each other,’ she said. ‘Just that there are people who don’t get along. I don’t know what Curtis is talking about. It’s dead.’

Although the group chat is no longer a thing, Anna and her sister are too busy securing the bag to care.

The two are releasing an edit with Essex-based footwear brand Simmi, and are showcasing their favourite styles.

Looks like Anna is bringing her sister Mandi along for the ride.
